communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA - Michael A. Taylor Incident
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

An electronic copy of the bodycam footage regarding the Michael A. Taylor incident that occurred on October 22, 2024 after a traffic stop at the Dollar General located at 914 Sheridan Rd, Winthrop Harbor, IL 60096. Taylor was arrested on the charges of bribery, aggravated battery to a peace officer and resisting a peace officer causing injury.

Specifically, I am seeking to obtain electronic copies of the:

1. BWC footage recorded by Winthrop Harbor Police Department's responding officers (main officer and assisting) detailing their full involvement in this incident

To assist you in locating the footage here are the key details of the incident:
Date of Event: October 22, 2024
Names: Michael A. Taylor
Location of Event: 914 Sheridan Rd, Winthrop Harbor, IL 60096

Please let me know if you require further information to process it.

If any aspects of this request are denied, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and please notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Johnson

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Pennsylvania Right to Know Act, I hereby request the following records:

An electronic copy of the bodycam footage regarding the Shawntinia Starks incident that occurred on April 10, 2024 at around 7 p.m. at the Boscov's located at 139 Falon Lane, Altoona, PA 16602. Starka was arrested on the charges of shoplifting, obstructing law enforcement and resisting arrest.

Specifically, I am seeking to obtain electronic copies of the:

1. BWC footage recorded by Logan Township Police Department's responding officers (primary and assisting) detailing their full involvement in this incident

To assist you in locating the footage here are the key details of the incident:
Date of Event: April 10, 2024
Names: Shawntinia Starks
Location of Event: 139 Falon Lane, Altoona, PA 16602

Please let me know if you require further information to process it.

If any aspects of this request are denied, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and please notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Johnson

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

A list of members that recently applied for the position of commander.  Their names, ranks, years of service and whether or not they were given an interview.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

John Publíc
